newsitem.title: USA: Fed's Rivlin backs drastic campaign finance reform.
newsitem.headline: Fed's Rivlin backs drastic campaign finance reform.

text.p: Deputy Federal Reserve Board chairman Alice Rivlin said Saturday she favored public campaign financing as an idea that would make good economic sense.
"I would favor campaign finance reform of a quite drastic sort," Rivlin told a forum on public policy at Bryn Mawr College in the Philadelphia suburb of Bryn Mawr.
"I would be for public financing of shortened campaigns," she said.

Rivlin was responding to Elaine Kamarck, a senior policy adviser to Vice President Al Gore, who argued that established, older companies use political donations to ensure continued government subsidies -- at the expense of newer industries that might actually contribute more to national productivity.
Rivlin concurred, saying the whole campaign finance system needed to be re-examined.
"The challenge is restoring the confidence of the American public that they can make a difference," Rivlin said.
